poem:
Title: "The Man on the Kremlin Wall"

Russians shiver beneath faces of stone.
Putin, once savior, now whispers of fear,
Transitions from rooster to wolf now full grown.
From Gorbachev's ghost, a cry we all hear.
Terror's pressure on walls once so grand,
His false strength betrays the frailty of sand.
A promised ruthless reign, but trust turned to sleight,
In midnight's bleak chill, who keeps safe the night?
